days.title: Cuyahoga National Park Partnership
days.description: The Cuyahoga Valley National Park is regularly one of the most visited parks in the country, and Cascade Subaru has a long-standing relationship with them. We support their goals of maintaining their "NE Ohio Trails Forever," which has over 100 miles of hiking trails to observe nature. The CVNP Environmental Education Center brings underprivileged inner city kids to camp where they are encouraged to explore nature. They learn about preservation through the three R's: reduce, reuse, and recycle. Many of the kids have never been out of the city and this opens a whole new world to them. It really hits home when one of the kids sees or learns something about the world around them that was entirely unknown. Cascade Subaru is proud that their contributions to the park help these children grown and learn while allowing everyone to observe the beauty of the world around them.
days.shortdesc: Cascade Subaru celebrates the 10-year anniversary of their remarkable partnership with; The Cuyahoga Valley National Park.

days.title: National Park Fund Partnership
days.description: Subaru of Puyallup selects Washington's National Park Fund as their Share the Love local charity, resulting in nearly $18,000 going to fund and maintain recreational areas including roads, trails, and parks, as well as improving the visitor experience.
days.shortdesc: Subaru of Puyallup selects Washington's National Park Fund as their Share the Love local charity.

days.title: Energy Star Small Business Award
days.description:
Planet Subaru, of Hanover, Massachusetts, wins the Energy Star Small Business Award.

Among many other efforts, Planet's signature initiative was the installation of a 78,540 watt rooftop solar plant, making Planet Subaru the only Subaru showroom in the world powered entirely by the sun.    

The 374 solar panels occupy about a quarter acre of Planet Subaru's roof and power the entire showroom:  lights, computers, monitors, phones, fax machines, photocopiers, refrigerators, coffee makers, water coolers, vending machines...everything previously powered by burning fossil fuels.   The panels provide approximately half of all the electrical power used by the entire dealership.  When the system produces more power than the dealership requires, the electric meter runs backwards and the power company buys the electricity from Planet Subaru.  

Planet's installation produces 88,752 kWh annually, enough to power approximately eight average American homes.    

Owners of Planet Subaru, brothers John and Jeff Morrill, are eager to reduce the environmental impact of their businesses. "Manufacturing and driving cars takes a heavy toll on the earth," Jeff Morrill said. "It is estimated that transportation alone is responsible for 25% of the world's carbon emissions, but buildings account for 43%, and while this family business can't reinvent the internal combustion engine, we can make a big difference in our facility."
days.shortdesc: America's only showroom completely powered by the sun, Planet Subaru recognized by Energy Star for their innovative use of renewable energy.

days.title: Goatscaping Begins at Planet Subaru
days.description:
Environmental innovators, Planet Subaru begins using goats and sheep to landscape its 11-acre facility. 

Planet Subaru owner Jeff Morrill said, "We have never used fertilizers, pesticides, or herbicides at Planet Subaru, and now we're working to reduce the use of gasoline mowers and trimmers, too."

The owners of Planet Subaru, brothers John and Jeff Morrill, have a longstanding committment to reducing the environmental impact of their businesses and has been greening its operations for years. Planet's facility boasts a rooftop solar installation with 374 solar panels that power the entire showroom. Planet Subaru also received one of only eight Energy Star Small Business Awards awarded by the United States Environmental Protection Agency.
days.shortdesc: Subaru hires the most environmentally-friendly lawnmowers in the world.

days.title: Historic National Parks Zero-Landfill Initiative
days.description: Subaru, together with the National Park Service and the National Parks Conservation Association, announces their Zero-Landfill Initiative, with the historic goal of making garbage in our national parks a thing of the past.
days.shortdesc: Subaru, together with the National Park Service and the National Parks Conservation Association, announces their Zero-Landfill Initiative, with the historic goal of making garbage in our national parks a thing of the past.

days.title: 2014 SIA Recycling Benefits Study
days.description:
As part of our commitment to being a zero-landfill auto manufacturer, our Subaru of Indiana plant recycled 32,561 tons of scrap metal, 1,690 tons of cardboard and paper, and 79 tons of wood.

 

Which, in real world terms, is the equivalent of conserving:

782,000 gallons of oil (enough energy to heat and cool more than 3,876 homes for one year)

40,500 gallons of gasoline (enough gasoline to drive 1,134,000 miles in an Outback)

11,829,000 gallons of water (enough water to meet the daily freshwater needs of 157,720 Americans)

29,100 mature trees (enough timber resources to produce more than 360,540,000 sheets of newspaper)

123,901,000 HW-Hrs of electricity (enough power to fulfill the annual electricity needs of more than 15,110 homes)

71,300 cubic yards of landfill airspace (enough airspace to fulfill the municipal waste disposal needs for a community of 91,549 Americans for one year)
days.shortdesc: An examination of the Subaru of Indiana Plant 2014 Recycling Benefits Study.
